meanings.definition: Halachists: Those who study or interpret Jewish religious law.
meanings.sent1: The halachists gathered to discuss the ancient Jewish laws.
meanings.sent2: Many halachists dedicate their lives to understanding Jewish religious law.
meanings.sent3: The halachists jokingly debated whether ancient Jewish laws applied to modern life.
meanings.sent4: She was a true halachist, always seeking to uncover the deeper meanings behind the religious laws.
meanings.sent5: The group of halachists meticulously analyzed every detail of the Jewish religious texts.

meanings.definition: Halachists: Experts in Jewish legal traditions and practices.
meanings.sent1: As halachists, they were well-versed in the intricate legal traditions of Judaism.
meanings.sent2: The halachists were consulted on matters of Jewish legal practices.
meanings.sent3: The halachists playfully challenged each other to a knowledge quiz on Jewish legal traditions.
meanings.sent4: Her father, a respected halachist, passed down his wisdom of Jewish legal practices to her.
meanings.sent5: The halachists' expertise in Jewish legal traditions was unmatched in the community.
